gpt-5-2025-08-07.patternDescription: The top six rows act as a header (program area). The actual output is formed by cropping away these six rows and modifying only the remaining rows. In the cropped area there is a small contiguous block of 8s (the seed). The transformation replicates this seed as vertical bands at specific column windows encoded in the header. The header is divided into four groups separated by the 5 delimiters. Each group contains a color marker and an adjacent run of three zeros, defining a potential column window. In the observed training examples, only two of these four windows are used: the central ones. The width of the replicated vertical bands matches the width of the seed (2-wide in the trainings, 3-wide in the test), and the bands overwrite whatever is underneath in the cropped area.
hints: Ignore the header: the output is the input without the first six rows.
Find the small 8 block in the cropped area; its width determines how wide the replicated vertical bands are.
Replicate the 8 block as vertical bands at the central two column windows encoded by the header's zero-triplets.
